alternate_methods:
You can order a certificate by telephone or post from the General Register Office:

- [Birth certificate application form](http://www.homeoffice.gov.uk/publications/agencies-public-bodies/ips/general-ips-publications/certificate-application-forms/birth-certificate-app-form "Birth certificate application form"){:rel="external"} 
- [Marriage certificate application form](http://www.homeoffice.gov.uk/publications/agencies-public-bodies/ips/general-ips-publications/certificate-application-forms/marriage-certificate-app-form "Marriage certificate application form"){:rel="external"}
- [Death certificate application form](http://www.homeoffice.gov.uk/publications/agencies-public-bodies/ips/general-ips-publications/certificate-application-forms/death-certificate-app-form?view=Standard&pubID=952199 "Death certificate application form"){:rel="external"}
- [Application form guidance notes](http://www.homeoffice.gov.uk/publications/agencies-public-bodies/ips/general-ips-publications/certificate-application-forms/app-form-guidance-notes?view=Standard&pubID=952208 "Download 'Application form guidance notes'"){:rel="external"}

A certificate costs £9.25. Make cheques or postal orders payable to 'IPS' (Identity and Passport Service).

$A
General Register Office  
PO Box 2  
Southport  
Merseyside  
PR8 2JD   
$A

$C **General Register Office**  
0300 123 1837 $C

You can also order certificates from the [local register office](/register-offices "local register office") where the birth, death or marriage was registered.
introduction: You can order a copy of a birth, death or marriage certificate from the General Register Office (GRO) online. You'll need to register with this service or log in if you've used it before.
